website_summaries.verdict: When you need to be able to adjust the angle and height of the mounted camera, this hardware makes it easy.
pros: Will be compatible with most models of cameras, as it uses a common 1/4 20" tripod mount
Contains numerous adjustable features, including a 360-degree tilt, a rotating arm, and an extendable height
cons: Perhaps too many features for some people's needs

customer_reviews.title: Best mount for in car Vlogs
customer_reviews.text: Best mount I've used so far. I stick to my windshield for Vlogging in my car. Pricey but worth it, I had a cheaper mount before and was very shaky. YouTube Channel JD JoyrideTV
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: Built Like a Mack Truck
customer_reviews.text: I co-produce an off-roading series called In4Lo, on Amazon Prime. I'm always looking for new ways to convey the experience of off-roading to our viewers. We've mounted GoPros to the inside and outside of trucks for years, but to get TV-quality resolution I needed to utilize a more professional camera and the Fat Gecko facilitated this. In fact the Fat Gecko performed flawlessly, even though, (as the attached video shows), my unstabilized Canon 6d did not. As it turned out a highly-stabilized camera is essential for off-road filming. My next plan is to use my Fat Gecko to attach a Lumix G9 - which has five-axis stabilization.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Marcos Studios

customer_reviews.title: Defective bolt
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: Updated my review from 2 to 1 star because even the replacement had the exact same issue. Will not hold up to any serious DSLR configurations (mine was barely 5lbs). Bolt connecting the arm to the suction cup plate is loose and was unable to sustain the weight of anything, let alone any sort of bumpy roads. I replaced the item assuming it was just a defective product but nope, even the replacement had the same issue. You set everything up, then screw on your camera and watch as the arm slowly starts to slip and rotate because of the lose bolt. I tried to tighten the bolt but nothing worked.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Only stick on glass...
customer_reviews.text: Be careful if you wish to mount this on non-glass surface for a long period of time, because it will not stick on for that long...I was trying to mount a video light on top of cabinet..it seems very secure in the beginning but 10 min later I realize it was completely loose....tried this several time and it is still the same. will not return because I have no intend to mount it on the side way (so it is not a big deal if it does not stick on top of cabinet, but I feel that for other people who intend to mount a more expensive camera on non-glass surface, single suction cup might not be a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle C

customer_reviews.title: Did its job well, stayed on my vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to attach a 360 degree camera to the top of my vehicle while driving through parks. It held it steady and had no issues with speeds topping 50MPH. I'm sure I could have gone faster, but this was the first week of using it. Make sure to keep a bottle of cleaner and some paper towels to remove any dirt, dust, or bug carcasses from your paint and windshield first. I also used a metal cable used for GoPro's for secondary security just in case it broke free for some reason, I didn't want to lose the camera, this rig, or possibly cause damage to the vehicle behind me from this flying off.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Voller

customer_reviews.title: STAYS where you put it
customer_reviews.text: This is a REAL review. I never review products before using them for a substantial amount of time. Bought this to mount my bluetooth anemometer outside. Cleaned the spot I wanted carefully and mounted on fiberglass side of my travel trailer. Stayed perfectly locked in place for 3 DAYS in moderate to high wind! That is a worthy test. It may well have stayed up twice that long but I had to leave. Clean the spot, find a good flat smooth surface and this thing REALLY WORKS.
customer_reviews.author: Docsarvis

customer_reviews.title: The Beast Of All Suction Mounts I've Ever Encountered... In A Good Way Mind You!
customer_reviews.text: This thing impressed me from the very start; the reviews, the easy-open packaging, to the looks, feel and durability. I bought this after many DIY attempts to mount, by other means, a device on the rear window of my vehicle. Push, click and done! I mis-positioned it at first so lifting it up proved a bit of a surprise but this confirmed that this would be a keeper and would suction well. Up close it seems big but truth in fact, it's not obtrusive at all. In fact, since it does the job intended sooooo weelll, I don't care about size but be assured it's normal. Perfect in my opinion. I've already recommended it to others. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus A. Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and secure
customer_reviews.text: For cockpit application holding an iPad, this is a highly secure suction cup based mount. Includes depress button to evacuate the air from within the cup, and a moveable tab to release the vacuum once it's in place. I decided on the single cup instead of the double-cup based on the recommendation of a captain who has used a single-cup for years, without a negative result. Given that the downside of the Gecko mounts is their bulk, I opted for the single. The only downside I perceive is the bulkiness, thus the 4-star on versatility. However, that bulkiness is what achieves the sturdiness. It's a well designed piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Knife T-rix

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I saw some using one of this in they youtube video. And I was I could use one of those for my video YT:him2wavy. So I went to searching, look online, they cost to much. So I went back to youtube with the correct name of the product, found this one in particular to be the one. Glad I ordered it, Its just as good, if not better than the gopro suction mount, I know this because I have both. It sturdy, holds my camera in place with not wobble.. If you look for a good suction camera mount, Get this unless u only need a one suction, or more than two....
customer_reviews.author: charles knight

customer_reviews.title: Use a camera with a stabilizer built in
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the camera mount and the stealth. I would say that the stealth one is more stable that the cam mount, but can be used for action cameras. The camera mount is stronger with good quality material, yet when I fixed my gopro on it, I could see the camera shakes at high speed. Only because of the stabilizer within the gopro, I could get a very good fotage with this device and even at high speed. The video above shows it all. I will try to upload more. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: cheap and affordable wont break the bank! Easy to use very simple and straightforward. its a hidden gem i dont see many talking or using this product. i did a few test with this and i feel completly comfortable and safe trusting my camera on it. only bad thing is i have the 2 cup setup with a mirrorless cam(Sony A7III) i would say no more then a 3-5 pound load (i believe the capacity is 8 pounds) it could be my streets but my footage is very bouncy at times thats with sony 5 star IBIS system.
customer_reviews.author: Juma

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a few times with a DSLR and it holds the camera in place securely. The three suction cups work so well that I could imagine it working for a slightly heavier camera too, like my Panasonic EVA1, but would probably need a stronger coupling point at the camera base. I even added a adaptable platform to accept a larger camera but worry it would be too top heavy for the small screw post it comes with. Perhaps a different attachment to the cups would bring out the versatility of this device.
customer_reviews.author: S L.

customer_reviews.title: Probably overkill
customer_reviews.text: This was probably a little too much for the camera I used it for (small action cam and a 360 cam). But it works amazing for this light camera! I had used a single suction cup version of this, and when extended up it would shake in the wind going down the road, even on a solid surface like the windshield. This thing doesn't shake at all. It is a little tricky to get it set up, but once you do it holds on tight. Like any suction cup cleaning the surface with alcohol if possible helps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for a GoPro or Smart Phone, Not for DSLR unless you like shake video.
customer_reviews.text: Tried mounting a Sony a6500 to the inside of my suv windshield for vloging. Worked great other then the bounce and shake this thing had. May work well for a cell phone or GoPro, but not a DSLR. Get a double or triple gecko for a DSLR. Update: my dslr works perfect on a 3 point mount. Get the tripple. 1 star for single 4 start for double 5 star for the tripple mount.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Made of Plastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I expected a rock-solid aluminum design. But no, at least 75% of it is plastic, and it sways in the wind when I connect only a 2ft extension pole to my action camera. Yes, a tiny little action camera overpowers this giant suction mount. If they had used aluminum, I would have bought another one or two. Going to have to find a different brand for the other cameras.
customer_reviews.author: MotoRider42HC

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty professional grade suction mount for cameras
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty camera suction mount. I bought this mount to properly attach a dash cam to the rear window of my pickup. The standard suction mounts that comes with car dash cams will come off after one to two months when in hot weather areas or times of the year. This was on the car for a year without coming off. It is truly a professional heavy duty mount. However, it is very large, heavy and buiky mount, but of excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: A. kolsrud

customer_reviews.title: Great for one use
customer_reviews.text: Used this once and it worked fine. Went to use it again and the suction cup will not stay attached for more than 2 minutes. Contacted the company about this and the fact it caused my camera to fall and damage a $150 lens despite it being well within the weight limit. All they cared about was reminding me that they are not responsible for damage caused by their product.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Delp

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: I use this to do hyperlapse videos, driving through national and state parks, and scenic areas in general. The unit is easy to install and adjust. It holds super-firmly to my windshield with a small video camera attached, and is easy to remove when finished. I even use it to make hyperlapse videos with a Galaxy Note 10 cell phone, by attaching a $5 adaptor/holder to the threaded camera mount screw. I haven't tried the included GoPro holder but it looks well made and I don't doubt that it would work just as well as the other pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has staying power!!! I recently drove 6400 miles, spread out over 10 days with this mount on the interior of my windshield. Each day, I placed My GoPro on the mount and removed it each night. It didn’t budge and was steady! The two or three suction cup mount is my next purchase for mounting on the exterior of my vehicle or camper.
customer_reviews.author: Edward F.

customer_reviews.title: KILLER CAR MOUNT, SUPER SECURE & WELL BUILT
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this product. Although it was a brand I wasn't familiar with, it had a lot of positive reviews. It is absolutely secure, with 7 points of security screws Rich give it tremendous flexibility. I've used it on the quarter panel of my car, attached to a DJI Ronin, with an A7 Sony on that. This may be a bit over the actual limit, as far as the weight reccomendation, but it held up like a champ and didn't even flinch. Solid composite plastic, quality suction cups that can pull dents out of cars, and a versatile, great system that allows virtually unlimited configurations. Definitely would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tech_CyNDicaTe

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Impressive little sucker. When mounted, properly, it hangs on for dear life even on the tank of my M/cycle. Nice and flexible in terms of positioning camera/light whatever you want to mount. Have not tried it with my Canon XF100 or any of my DSLRs but I'm confident it could hold them on a smooth road. But for the plethora of GoPro knock offs out there this is perfect. Lastly while it is made of plastic it is not thin/easily breakable plastic, clamping down hard to make sure things don't move is not likely to break or split any of it. Would I buy another... certainly will when I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Anon E. Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Not for G7X
customer_reviews.text: I have a G7X and this would not hold it up at all. I looked at other reviews and people said it held theirs up, but mine just kept falling down. So if you have a Canon G7X or something similar, buy the bigger version. This one will not hold your camera up and you might risk breaking the camera every time it falls.
customer_reviews.author: Josi Rydin

customer_reviews.title: I love this product and will repurchase another one for our ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and will repurchase another one for our other car. It is good quality and not all plasticky at all. But most of all it really adheres to the smooth surface(my windshield) and does not budge or shakes compared to my other one. It also has sinstantial weight to it so I am more comfortable my camera attach to this car mount. My only gripe is how long it took to get to me. Over 8 days. Amazon did sent it after my concern and complain but has not refunded me with the $11 shipping they charge me without my consent. Thank goodness I caught it and now will have Amazon refund me back.
customer_reviews.author: Maria C.

customer_reviews.title: falls off
customer_reviews.text: It was good when I first got it on the first six months as far as the suction concern, when i forgot to remove it one day basking under the hot summer sun the suction become weak and it would not hold for 10 minutes even if nothing attached to it will falls off. suction cup became hard overtime.
customer_reviews.author: Lahree

customer_reviews.title: There are better options out there
customer_reviews.text: At first I was impressed with it and until I started looking at it closer and it is cheaply made or maybe I should say they cut a lot of corners. The metal threads on the stud aren't even machined correctly and some other plastic parts don't fit together very well either I ended up returning mine and ordering a higher quality one.
customer_reviews.author: Chad K

customer_reviews.title: SO EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: I really thought this would be harder to use, but no joke, I put it up correctly the first time as a joke. My husband was telling me how we'd need to clean the window, and use alcohol yada yada, but I put it up and BOOM. Haven't taken it down since. I live in Texas where it gets HOT, and have not noticed any loss in suction or stability.
customer_reviews.author: hiimtherese

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to mount my GoPro to and video driving through the Canadian Rockies on route to hiking trailheads. This worked great! Easy to use and the suction is excellent. I've used it again and again and the suction works great. The angle etc. is adjustable so it's easy to use as you need.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: I'm extremely happy with this mount
customer_reviews.text: The Fat Gecko triple is a BEAST! Hangs on tight and stays in place. I actually attached a 5D mk III to the exterior of the car and drove around, first on a few side streets, then along a few major streets (just had to remove the Canon strap before I set out, to be on the safe side). I've also mounted it to the sun roof, and on the windshield (had to hang the 5D upside down, due to the configuration of my car's windshield... Flipped the image in post). It supports big, heavy DSLRs without flinching! I'm extremely happy with this mount!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Robertson

customer_reviews.title: YGWYPF. Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Supports my Canon 80D with 18-135mm lens, Rode mic WITH the extension on at 90 degrees (perfectly horizontal) while suction cupped to my passenger window for days and hundreds of miles of driving highways, cities, driveways (I deliver packages for a living)
customer_reviews.author: JahkiBoy

customer_reviews.title: Outstandingly GREAT for my YouTube Shave Channel filming
customer_reviews.text: This built very well and I am 100 percent satisfied with the quality, the easy of operation and the trust I have in it to hold my camera securely while filming straight on mirror video for my DE Shave Talk WITH Kit Shave Channel. Very highly recommended ~!
customer_reviews.author: Kit G. Jors

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad buy.
customer_reviews.text: My only issue it that with the Sony Action Cam, it is hard to windshield mount with the camera facing out the window, with out flipping the image recording. Might be able to figure a position out with flipping the mounting arm and angle. Seems to stick great to a warm window, and doesn't transmit many vibrations to the camera. So pretty solid build.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most stable mount I can find
customer_reviews.text: I use this suction mount with a aluminum phone clamp for record my driving on the race track. Video is taken using Samsung Galaxy Note 10+ without image stabilization, on the inside of windshield. There are tremendous forces and vibration driving on the track and this Fat Gecko mount keep the phone (and video) very stable.
customer_reviews.author: HAO W.

customer_reviews.title: Secure fit for your camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have an option to shoot driving scenes and car interiors, with the added bonus of having a secure mount inside my car to hold my phone as a gps. I tested it out on the hood after cleaning the contact surface of anything that would inhibit it's suction and I was pleasantly surprised. I could pop dents out of my vehicle with this if the need arose. Would definitely recommend this product to any filmmakers needing a budget friendly option to secure your camera to your car.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Horn

customer_reviews.title: Re-Review - worth all the money and more - Excellent
customer_reviews.text: So this is my re-review after having it for a few days. It is sturdy af. Strong and durable. Rather big which I love about it. It feels like it's worth more like $69.99. the sucking is so strong it's hard to get off which is also great.
customer_reviews.author: Lotus Fairy

customer_reviews.title: The biggest secret to shooting through hotel room glass windows
customer_reviews.text: I never go on a trip without this. Perfect for mirrorless cameras (I'm using it with a Sony A6000).
customer_reviews.author: Suntoryjim

customer_reviews.title: this would be perfect. It sticks really well to the windshield
customer_reviews.text: If i were using this for a light weight sports camera, this would be perfect. It sticks really well to the windshield. I was hoping it would work with my Canon R72 video camera but it was too heavy. I gave this 5 stars because I feel like this works (very well) as advertised and it was not marketed for heavier cameras. I just took a chance.
customer_reviews.author: smackauf

customer_reviews.title: Strong suction and flexible design.
customer_reviews.text: Holds 3 pound camera easily with just 2 of the legs. I use the third leg as a security anchor with a lanyard to the camera. Used on sloping windshield for many hours with no issues even over rough road. Flexible positioning and strong suction make this very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Zadie

customer_reviews.title: Bring it on
customer_reviews.text: This would stand stuck through a hurricane, I have used this about seven times and it has exceeded all my expectations, I see the movies of the before and then I see then with this and the stillness is amazing, this thing feels like it is going to last for generations, the number of angles and positions is as close to infinity as you can get, I mount this inside my vehicles and other surfaces (so far all smooth metal or plastic) and I was shocked and elated on how firmly this locks into place, and once locked the 1,000's of ways to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfie

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: Unlike some of the cheaper suction cup mounts, the Delkin Fat Gecko actually sticks and stays in place providing that you adhere to the directions. With the inferior suction cup mounts, I had to invest in a product called "Suction Cup Buddy" which is essentially a sticky jell pad that facilitates extra adhesive abilities. Although the base of this mount does not swivel, the locking screw allows me to position my digital recorders or camera in any orientation I need. Overall, although someone will always find faults in every product, I sincerely believe that the Fat Gecko will be an excellent mount for the majority of your needs.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be reasonably well-built, considering its price. I haven't had it fall off of anything -- including filming my car driving over bumps. I wouldn't mount anything heavy with it, but a GoPro-style action camera seems to be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Suction power great, mounting system not so great.
customer_reviews.text: The suction mount stayed on like a champ through extreme heat. The mounting system broke the first day I was used it. If you're mounting the camera inside the car, on the windshield, take camera size into consideration as the Fat Gecko is small but still takes up a noticeable amount of space with the camera attached. As great as the suction worked, I would not repurchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Juliana

customer_reviews.title: Worked on a biplane!
customer_reviews.text: We attached this to the rearview mirror on the upper wing of a Stearman biplane and it worked great. didn't move at all. I'm comfortable putting this on the outside of so many things because of that.
customer_reviews.author: B Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Very secure grip, stable car-top camera video too.
customer_reviews.text: I attached this to my sunroof glass and mounted my gear 360 to it to video a classic car cruise, and it worked great. Solid grip, and very stable video. As others have said and as the instructions say, clean the surface and the suction cups first every time.
customer_reviews.author: J_E_Beck

customer_reviews.title: This is a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I got this in addition to the other two that make up a 3 suction rig. I am using this on the 8k Instapro 360 camera right now with a ball head and it's not even flinching! It said 12 pounds and I can only imagine that's because of the frame which is a hardened plastic because the suction cups aren't going anywhere. Don't get me wrong though, the plastic isn't cheap, it just may not be solid enough for a 20 pound rig with its narrow support. This is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Autohitch

customer_reviews.title: WORTH THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I can’t seem to mount my camera right side up in my car with it, I can always edit and turn the video around but there’s no way I can mount it so the camera is not upside down in the windshield. Besides that super great suction you can literally pull in it’s not coming off.Besides that super great suction you can literally pull in it’s not coming off, very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and sturdy mount - holds even a large cameras with ease
customer_reviews.text: This well-built mount system is nicer and stronger than I expected. It can easily hold my Nikon D7000 with battery grip and a pretty heavy lens without any problem. It's adjustable to adapt to most situations. The only thing that I wish it had was a Manfrotto quick-release mount. I made that wish come true by adding this adapter: Now I can move the camera from the Fat Gecko to my tripod in seconds. I'm very satisfied with the build-quality, materials and versatility of the Fat Gecko.
customer_reviews.author: M. Evangelist

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I have used it mounted on my Jeep's windshield to record off-roading adventures and it never came off, the suction cup works great. The only issue I had was the the mount just does not extend far enough back for the camcorder I use (JVC Everio) and the steepness of a Jeep windshield, the front of the camcorder barely touches the windshield so the video playback there is a constant rattle of the camcorder hitting the windshield. I was able to resolve the issue by putting a small piece of felt on the front of the camcorder, but between the three variables (mount, camera, windshield) it is just not perfect....but it is pretty close.
customer_reviews.author: H. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and stable
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this for arriving/departing shots of my cross country road trip for my GoPro. After seeing how crazy strong this thing is, I actually use my $3,500 DSLR/Lens combination on the hood of my car. I do use a little safety line from the camera to my windshield wiper just in case, but it has NEVER even remotely come close to coming undone or needing the safety line even at pretty high speeds. Having the three legs really helps to keep the footage stable and with a little stabilization in post the footage looks amazing. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: Handy for Interesting Angled Shots
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work okay on glass at least. The suction does not work for me on other flat surfaces that the description says should. Tried to use one on a motercycle helmet and it would not even stay connected to that with its smooth shiny finish! I was hoping to use these on some external car window shots I need with my less expensive camcorder but I can't trust this will hold even at slow speeds on a flat and straight roadway. Still this works great for interior glass so far and will have its uses in my work.
customer_reviews.author: sayheyjayray

customer_reviews.title: Great strong suction cup mount.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to mount my FeiyuTech WG2X with my GoPro Hero 7 Black attached to the inside of my windshield. It holds great and is very strong. The only gripe I would have, is that is bulky to pack away for traveling. I usually just disassemble it then reassemble it on location.
customer_reviews.author: LilStomper

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy mount
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to hold a Wyze Cam Pan 1080p PTZ on a sliding glass door. It's been mounted for over 70 days and has not moved or changed position since it was initially installed. It provides a myriad of mounting options, lengths, and positions. I'd highly recommend for both home and auto applications if you want a camera in position for a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY strong suction mounting!
customer_reviews.text: This thing had awesome gripping power. I have used it to mount my gopro to the exterior of my car and to the interior side of my back window to do an over the shoulder video. Its rated to handle much bigger and heavier cameras and I don't doubt that it could handle them. But I went with this for by gopro, because I'm making racing videos with my Corvette, which can generate some g- force and had a 'firm' ride. Adjustability is also excellent.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mitchum

customer_reviews.title: Works well with GoPros
customer_reviews.text: I have tested this with my GoPro on the outside of my car many times now and have not lost it yet... You need to make sure the suction cup is stuck on well... I also tend to add a safety line so if it does fail the camera is not lost. Works well one window glass and flat body panels... On my ATV it stays put even over rough terrain when properly applied... Stuck to the inside of airplane glass it has stayed put through turbulence and pressure changes...
customer_reviews.author: chris bordeleau

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: The Fat Gecko Mini Camera Mount was purchased to use with my DJI Osmo Pocket and it worked perfectly. I haven't tried it with any other product mounted but, this is proving to be the perfect tool for mounting small devices to various surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: LuvMusic

customer_reviews.title: Essentially a slider.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this while I was driving. Unfortunately the footage was too shaky. If you drive slow the footage looks great. Imagine if you wanted to use a slider for a whole street of houses. You could use this attached to your car. Just drive slow and steady and you get beautiful footage. This product did not work for what I needed it for. ( stable freeway footage ), I did find it useful for other things. I am very satisified
customer_reviews.author: woody

customer_reviews.title: It Sucks and it's Worth The Money!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and to adjust. Great quality. This thing sucks better than a...well let's just say it holds on really tight to smooth non-porous surfaces. It's ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: SAVJR

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT mount, accident survivor!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted a few ways before a long motorcycle trip, 1300+ miles, not problem. 2 different cameras used, pretty damn solid mount. Held on to the gas tank, even through an accident.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Olson

customer_reviews.title: Nice and solid
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid little holder. I use this to hold my phone in the car bat have used it many other ways. Sticks to glass or paint and you can adapt whatever you need to it.
customer_reviews.author: Liberated Seaman

customer_reviews.title: A most versatile mount for Go Pro-type cameras
customer_reviews.text: I shoot a lot of car videos. I need to shoot pictures of me driving, the suspension underneath the car, the grill, you name it. And I usually don't have a lot of time to do it, so adjustment speed is a must. The mount that came with my Go Pro was limited in how I could adjust the camera position and angle. This mount solves the problem. It's versatile and flexible. Makes it easy to position the angle and direction of the camera in just about any way you want. You must have the Go Pro tripod mount to use. It is also priced very reasonably. Works great for small cameras like the Go Pros.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting something to mount my camcorder to my car windshield so I could record some of my scenic travel. This fits the bill. I was a bit worried about getting everything lined up since the windshield on my Lincoln MKX slants a LOT. Once I added the extender it fit just fine. I went for a test drive on some bumpy roads and worried a bit when I saw the camcorder bouncing but when I viewed the video at home it was barely noticeable. I think the stabilization in my camcorder may have helped. Next I want to try it out on my Harley to see how well it works!
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: The dual suction Fat Gecko DSLR mount is a great inexpensive way to film in-car scenes. The suction cups are some of the most secure cups I've ever used. I purchased this mount in January of 2016, and as of February 2017, the mount is still exactly where I mounted it to the inside of my windshield the day I received it, through the heat of the summer and the cold of winter. The mount is very lightweight, while also being very sturdy, resulting in a very stable picture.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Adcock

customer_reviews.title: The mount works pretty well, I used it for a road trip ...
customer_reviews.text: The mount works pretty well, I used it for a road trip from Arizona to California and it held up really well. The only reason I am able to give it a 4/5 stars is because it is super inconvenient to take and mount the actual camera (DSLR). I was using a Canon 70D as my main camera to record the road and also to take pictures. However it took a couple tries to mount the camera onto the mounting hole unless you take the entire mount off which is very inconvenient. Other than the the film quality is pretty great even though my car is lowered and has a rough suspension (Lexus ISF).
customer_reviews.author: Apex

customer_reviews.title: Takes effort to setup but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It takes a while to setup, lots of screws and minor adjustments. With a DSLR it was a bit limiting because the arm isnt very long so in some positions the camera hits the suction cups and I have to redo it all. If it had a slightly longer arm to out the camera body away from the mount it would earn 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: AMR

customer_reviews.title: Confirmed: Suction strong enough for over 35+ mph
customer_reviews.text: I recently used this setup with only two of the main suction cups attached and had no issues at speeds of over 35 mph. Camera mounted was a Sony A7s with a Rokinon 24mm 1.4 lens attached and I had no failures what so ever, Just make sure to clean area before mounting and to tighten the camera on the screw head heavily to ensure the wind doesn't move the camera. Thanks Delkan!
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent suction mount
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mount to hold a 7" monitor to use with a backup camera for my truck. The monitor came with a deck stand that could be attached to the dash, but no one in their right mind is going to permanently mount a monitor to their dash so I shopped for a suction mount instead. This mount has worked superbly. The suction cup has been strong and has not needed adjustment or reapplication after months of installation. The mount's frame is also strong and robust and comes with a free extension that other mounts charge extra for. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Anyone who is looking to do video from inside the vehicle would do good by purchasing this three suction cup mount
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks, I attach my Canon M6 with a 18 to 150 lens to the passenger side window of my Corvette and this three suction cup mount has never let go even under some hard acceleration. Anyone who is looking to do video from inside the vehicle would do good by purchasing this three suction cup mount. In my book it was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy L Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Very sturdy. Seems so strong it could have held me up (didn't test so I don't recommend it) but overall pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: BryanG

customer_reviews.title: Great but with a warning label
customer_reviews.text: Great but with a warning label...the first one I bought I have used on the wing of a plane going well over 100 mph/kts maybe 10 times...also used on top of a car...the second one is now missing with a $100 camera attached to it...I had used a couple times and the last time it slipped before take off...I then made sure I could not pull it off...well while flying I looked at the right wing and it was gone...I will continue to use my Mobius $80 camera on the outside of the plane but I will not use a $200+ camera outside
customer_reviews.author: Gary Veduccio

customer_reviews.title: Good price but poor performance
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I was impressed with the design of this mount. And I thought it was a steal for the price. Then I went and did a track day. With my DSLR attached and the mount attached to the rear window of my car, I thought it would work well. But then I looked at my footage--and it was basically unusable. There's WAY too much shake, similar to what other reviews have noted. The mount may appear to be sturdy, but it doesn't do the job where it matters, and that is ensuring that your footage comes out free of shake. Don't be tempted by the price and purchase a different mount instead.
customer_reviews.author: DucRider

customer_reviews.title: Tracing Vehicle
customer_reviews.text: This thing sticks like a price tag on flower bouquets. Carries a G85 well, also use it for additional bracing for the big gimbal.
customer_reviews.author: abideawhileacres

customer_reviews.title: My 'camera car'
customer_reviews.text: This totally works as advertised! I used it on the roof of my rental car in Italy to document the 'white road' route to our 'podere' in Chianti. No way that route was on a printed map. I'm back in So_Cal now, and looking forward to documenting some spots in the Santa Monica Mountains and in Malibu. Agree with the prior reviewer that it would be good to be able to mount other devices to the Gecko. Seems like it would be easy enough to make an adapter to accommodate iPhones, GPS's, and the like. Still, this is a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby D

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Budge
customer_reviews.text: Once in place, this thing fits secure! I used it on my passenger door window for a separate angle, and it worked better than my regular mount.
customer_reviews.author: Kwen

customer_reviews.title: Not for every dashboard.
customer_reviews.text: The suction is amazing. But doesn’t work well in every car. It depends on the shaping or curvature of your dashboard.
customer_reviews.author: Bruutal Beauty

customer_reviews.title: best suction camera mount i've tried so far.
customer_reviews.text: very solid mount, strong suction cup, and rigid mounting arm means video quality is as close to perfect as it can possibly be, minimal vibration and shaking. well designed arm and joints with awesome range of rotation, resulting in limitless mounting options for all your shooting needs.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Mount!
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. It can be a bit bulky on the window, but it holds perfect and is able to position at great angles. It has a lot of options for several devices. Really recommend this if you are a one to vlog!
customer_reviews.author: imjessicaolivia

customer_reviews.title: Great for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I plan to use the mount to record a trip up the coastal route 1 in California with a Sony video camera. I tested the mount by driving approximately 20 miles over smooth and rough roads, very rough roads. between the mount and the built in steady feature of the camcorder there was no vibration or unwanted motion of the camcorder even when driving through dips in the road. I used the horizon as a reference point when available and houses when the horizon was not available. By the way, I was using the extension that came with the mount because of the slant of my windshield.
customer_reviews.author: M Matt

customer_reviews.title: I love this mount!
customer_reviews.text: I tested this mount with a Canon Vixia HF R20. I test drove with this mount (tethered by rope just in case), while it was mounted to my hood. Then inside on the passenger side glass. And finally, on the inside of the front windshield. It held without fail during my driving test of 25mph max. I drove slowly over several unavoidable speedbumps as well and it didn't budge. It is EXTREMELY strong. The components are either metal or a very strong and durable plastic. I am very happy with this purchase and would highly recommend this product. Why can't more manufacturers sell products that actually work????
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Securely mounts even with extension pole
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a 2 foot extension pole and it mounts nicely to my car. Locks in nicely and feels super snug.
customer_reviews.author: Brit Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Car Front Bumper Mount
customer_reviews.text: Very, very secure suction mount making for stable shots for high-speed car videos. Recommend 100%. Perfect for adjustable, low to the ground, front bumper shots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very solid mount!
customer_reviews.text: I used this mount to attach a microphone onto the back bumper of my car. I take my car to the race track pretty frequently but couldn't stand the wind noise in my videos. Hence I decided to buy an external microphone and mount it to the back of my car using this mount. Although I haven't had a chance to test it out at triple digit speeds, I did do a quick test on local streets and the mount seemed very secure. I would say this mount is just as good as the suction mount that comes with the GoPro cameras (which I also have). Here's a link to the Mic test using this mount:
customer_reviews.author: DJI

customer_reviews.title: ... this up based on reviews and I couldn't be happier! I used it with a Polaroid xs100i and ...
customer_reviews.text: Pick this up based on reviews and I couldn't be happier! I used it with a Polaroid xs100i and mount it to the tank of my Kawasaki ZX10R for my track day and it performed flawless! No vibrations and plenty of adjustment for the camera to get the best angle posible. after a couple of section I decided to move the bracket to the lower front fairing and it also worked flawless with minimal vibration of the fairing at high speed. I hit 155mph multiple times on the straightaway and it held just fine.
customer_reviews.author: christian abreu

customer_reviews.title: yea it's good
customer_reviews.text: I can do exactly what i need to with this. After messing with all the knobs it's very sturdy. I drove around with it outside the car around 45-50mph and it didn't move at all. I have a Canon 80d with a Sigma 18-50mm and it's pretty heavy. So far no issues.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: In-car gimble mount for sunroof glass
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to mount a Hohen iSteady 2 Action Camera gimbal upside down to my sunroof. Suction cup is powerful enough to hold very securely while driving. Works great and would highly recommend it for this type of application. *NOTE, I have not used in direct sun for extended periods of time so that may affect performance.
customer_reviews.author: Gladness

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: I received this three days ago and tried it out today. I set it up on the inside of the front windshield of my car,along with my Camcorder(had to use the extention also)and took my half hour drive to work. This mount just stayed solid on the windshield and held the camcorder very stable. When I got to work it was a little early so I checked out the video and it was awesome! Very well made and you can point your device on several angles, also the suction cup is very strong. I would recommend this mount to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: It works, but can not be relied upon to hold. The 3 cup may be a better option. It is also made of cheap metal which rusts.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works well, sticks securely
customer_reviews.text: My car has a fairly steep windshield and it took me a few minutes to figure out what the extra piece was and how to attach it to the camera mount. The suction cup is very strong. I had a little bit of trouble adjusting the camera mount so that my camera was parallel to the ground and could take a level picture. The suspension on my car is a little stiff and depending on the roads that I am driving on, the camera mount vibrates. This can result in shaky video. I haven't encountered any unusable video yet, knock on wood...
customer_reviews.author: familyBusyness

customer_reviews.title: I have zero fears of my camera flying off the car. Very good product. (Very pricey, yes, but very good.)
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive, but I'm glad I bought it. I have zero fears of my camera flying off the car. It is SOLID. I was thinking of mounting it to the roof with a baby seat on it... just kidding. But it's really very strong and stable. Also, and this is way cool, you can take it apart and have 3 single mounts, or a single and a double. I also bought the extension kit , but it only offered liimited usability. This works great on it's own.
customer_reviews.author: Stickman

customer_reviews.title: Stayed on windshield with FIMI palm and iPhone 6
customer_reviews.text: Worked great combined with cell phone/mini camera mount. No issues using FIMI Palm or iPhone 6S.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Walter

customer_reviews.title: Good for DSLR. Use three legged version for heavier lens.
customer_reviews.text: Used this on the side of a sedan, and it worked great. I used a Canon 5d Mark II with an L series 24-105mm. I didn't feel safe using that combo, so I switched to a prime lens. It worked beautifully. Always remember to secure your camera with a strap, in case of failure. But mine didn't, even goinf 65 mph with my camera outside the window.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Earl Dent III

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to get!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a handful of products similar to this one for my helmet camera, this was the only one that actually stuck. With similar suction mounts, I've lost two cameras on the road while riding my motorcycle. This product worked great! I don't have any complaints. 5 of 5.
customer_reviews.author: BC360

customer_reviews.title: Great, flexible suction mount
customer_reviews.text: Great, flexible suction mount. The tri-pot style mount can easily accommodate most camera and camcorder, and with a simple GoPro tripod adapter I can mount a GoPro to the outside of my vehicle easily as well. Strong suction, I left it attached to the side of my piano for my daughter's piano lessons, and it stayed there for weeks on end without losing any suction. I haven't tried this with heavier SLR type camera bodies.
customer_reviews.author: the_hack2321

customer_reviews.title: So Far its Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Well I only had for a few days and So far its Great. I've been using it in my car for some camera action up front and I just attached it to my motorcycle helmet to see how it works and well it held but will see when summer comes to put it to a true road test. I had put a mini-disc camera on the helmet and it was a bit heavy, then I tried a much smaller camera with worked out well. The Mount sticks and hold great plus has an extention for a bit more length. For the price is worth it and also its solid. Too bad I cant put some pics here.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the lake!
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine in 2012. Love it, love it. I attach mine to my Jetski and use my Hero camera. Even with all the bumps and jumps it holds tight. My only complaint is they didn't use stainless steel screws. Even though I rinse and dry my mount, the screws that adjust the suction cup angle are so corroded and rusted that I can adjust them anymore. Still works good for my Jetski but I am planning to get another, replace the screws to stainless if I can, so I can still adjust the angle of the suction cups even after it gets wet.
customer_reviews.author: A. Snowden

customer_reviews.title: It is very sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in a timely fashion. It is very sturdy and durable. The directions are very simple even though it took a little while for me to assemble the extension. I was able to stick this product to my table using my Canon G7x and also use this in my car mounted on my windshield. It is even strong enough to hold up my dslr camera Canon T3i. It holds up to 5 lbs which my Canon T3i weighs 2.0 lbs. I purchased this product with my own money and this review is based upon my honest opinion.
customer_reviews.author: NiqueNatural

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong choosing this Camcorder Mount!
customer_reviews.text: The Fat Gecko Mini Camera and Camcorder Mount has to be the best mount I've encountered thus far. It's well built and feels very sturdy. It mounts to my car window very securely. I also mounted it to the flat plastic on my dash that is not textured. It has not fallen or lost any suction while holding my Sony NEX5R at highway speeds and bumpy roads. I'd recommend this mount for any in car videos you plan to take. Excellent product shipped very securely and fast!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and flexible
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and configurable. You can find a way to set it up for almost anything you need it for. The only problem I had with it is sometimes when mounted on the windshield the arm can get in the way of the widescreen. Though this is minor and with some fiddling can be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Keith O'Day

customer_reviews.title: fat gecko does the job
customer_reviews.text: Love this mount. Currently using it as a cell phone mount in my car. Holds very steady and very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: JustinD

customer_reviews.title: Great little mounts with solid construction...
customer_reviews.text: These mounts are great, in fact I have purchased four already to use as mounts for Foscam wireless cameras. Of course mounting the Foscam inside negates the IR mode of the camera altogether, but makes for a secure mount for daytime recordings/viewings. The longer neck of the mount is handy for stationary mounting, but proves to exaggerate the vibrations you experience in a moving vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba from Bama

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera mount!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the other reviews on it. They said it was heavy duty and the suction cup is very strong and stays attached quite well. I purchased this product for autocross and road course open track events. I attened an open track event this past weekend, and used this mount on the outside of the car. At the fastest point on the track, I was traveling well over 100+ MPH and this thing hung on extremly well! I did not fear that it would let loose and my camera would hit the track and smash into a 1000 pieces! I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: WOW this thing really holds the video camera in the car.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a really strong VIDEO HD camera holder and this one is very well made and worth the price. I cant stand the GoPro as a real HD video camera picks up awesome sound and can be burned to a DVD also. I have it mounted on the small dash of my AC Cobra which takes a lot of jarring and G force but this mount hangs on. The multiple adjustments are perfect for getting it right.
customer_reviews.author: CatDaddy & Biatch
